uk.ac.aber.dcs.cs12320.cards

Class ScoreCard

  • java.lang.Object
    • uk.ac.aber.dcs.cs12320.cards.ScoreCard

  • public class ScoreCard
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that contains an ArrayList of scores and allows us to read in scores from a file and to save them. It can put the scores in order and can determine if a score is worthy of saving.
    Version:
    1.3(4th May 2015)
    Author:
    Nicholas Rostant

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void addScore(int newScore)
      Determines if the score provided is low enough to join the leaderboard and if so will add it and if the board is full will remove the worst score
      void printScores()
      Prints the scores to the console
      void saveCard(java.lang.String fileName)
      Saves the score card to a file with format "scores_FILENAME.TXT"

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        equals, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • saveCard

        public void saveCard(java.lang.String fileName)
        Saves the score card to a file with format "scores_FILENAME.TXT"
        Parameters:
        fileName - the filename of the deck being used

      • printScores

        public void printScores()
        Prints the scores to the console

      • addScore

        public void addScore(int newScore)
        Determines if the score provided is low enough to join the leaderboard and if so will add it and if the board is full will remove the worst score
        Parameters:
        newScore - score attained
